Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Catastrophic \Cat`a*stroph"ic\, a. Of a pertaining to a catastrophe. --B. Powell. [1913 Webster]
catastrophic adj : extremely harmful; bringing physical or financial ruin; "a catastrophic depression"; "catastrophic illness"; "a ruinous course of action" [syn: {ruinous}]
